fact: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the first moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.'
The first 1GB hard drive, introduced in 1980, weighed over 500 pounds.
Neutron stars are so dense that a single cubic centimeter would weigh about 400 million tons.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
The Olympic Games were originally a religious festival in honor of Zeus in ancient Greece.
The world's most expensive coffee, Kopi Luwak, is made from coffee beans that have been eaten and then excreted by civet cats.
The world’s largest music festival, Donauinselfest, takes place every year in Austria and attracts over 3 million visitors.
Vincent van Gogh only sold one painting during his lifetime, 'The Red Vineyard,' which was sold for 400 francs.
A photon can travel through a vacuum at 186,282 miles per second, the speed of light.
William Shakespeare is credited with inventing over 1,700 words in the English language.
Zero was first used as a placeholder in ancient Mesopotamia around 3rd century BC.
Dark chocolate is rich in antioxidants and can improve brain function.
The first computer virus, 'Creeper,' was created in 1971 and displayed the message, 'I'm the creeper, catch me if you can!'
Saturn’s moon Titan has lakes of liquid methane and ethane on its surface.
The longest movie ever made is 'Logistics,' which runs for 35 days, 17 hours, and 22 minutes.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896. Zanzibar surrendered after 38 minutes.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
More people have access to a mobile phone than to a toilet.
